alert.note: Alert for Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County; Owens Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 14 at 9:13AM PST until February 15 at 10:00AM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, northwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gust over 60 mph. After 4 PM, northwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Eastern Sierra Slopes and Owens Valley. * WHEN...until 4 PM PST this afternoon then will become an Advisory, lasting until 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Blowing dust will reduce visibility to less than a mile at times. Power outages are possible. Travel will be hazardous. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This area has been upgraded to a High Wind Warning based on observations of gust over 60 mph and near zero visibility associated with dust in the Owens Valley. These conditions are expected for the Highway 395 corridor through 4 PM this afternoon. Winds are expected to lessen somewhat but still remain strong after 4 PM, and this warning will be replaced by a Wind Advisory.
info.instruction: Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other lightweight fixtures and unsecured outdoor objects. Operators of motorcycles, vans, campers, trailers, and other high profile vehicles should be especially cautious for the possibility of sudden, strong crosswinds and be prepared for areas of blowing dust which could drastically reduce visibility.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County; Owens Valley
